p: As a significant contributor to global morbidity and mortality, seasonal influenza is an ongoing public health concern. Worldwide, these annual epidemics are estimated to result in about three to five million cases of severe illness, and about 290,000 to 650,000 respiratory deaths [ 1]. In England, seasonal influenza inflicts a stark burden on the health system during winter periods, being linked with approximately 10% of all respiratory hospital admissions and deaths [ 2].
